data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person would face backwards to revert to the starting point. The answer: No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around turns right and you want to turn right off of the 4th step. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 6 steps or 4 steps to get back to your starting point, that means the same thing as taking 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right (again). Take 6 more steps to turn left. Take 1 more step to turn left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right and take three steps next to the starting point. Turn around and take one step. Take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around and take 7 steps to turn around. Turn right turns left. Turn right turns left. Turn around back and take 7 steps to turn around. So, the answer is yes.

A person can only face forward. If you are constantly facing backwards then you would only be able to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Take 2 steps first. Take 3 steps next. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around with two steps. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Just a little tip to keep in mind : Always face forward.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

There are 6 steps backwards, so you take 1 step backward. 8 steps right is the same as 5 steps left. Just because you took 1 step backward does not make that step return back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

It’s not going to the starting point. It only takes 2 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

You always take steps forward. Taking one step right goes right to the previous step. So, the answer is No.

The number of steps you take depends on your speed, how you are facing forward, and the direction you are facing. In order to keep you from going backward, take 6 steps left instead of 1. Thus, the answer is No.

Turn around means take a 180 degree turn in one direction and back that way. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. The total number of steps is 8 + 4 + 4 + 10 + 8 = 56 steps. So, the answer is No.

You took 2 steps at the start of the journey. Your next step are 3 steps. When you are walking toward the same direction and back with the same journey you started the previous way you were going, your next 3 steps are at the starting point, and your next 6 steps are at the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Take 2 steps right. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Therefore, the answer is No.

Walking straight is not the same as walking around. Turning right also means turning around. So, the answer is No.

You always start by facing forward. If you stay facing down, you always take the opposite direction from the starting point. You always take 10 steps right, so you always come up with 10 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

Reversing a direction can not always be back to its original setting. So, the answer is no.

There are usually more steps back than steps forward. So, the answer is No.

Each method of returning to the starting point has 3 distinct parts. Taking 6 steps left after facing forward, then 1 step backward after facing forward, then 4 steps right after facing forward, then 3 steps left after facing forward, then 4 steps right after facing forward, then 4 steps right after facing forward, then 3 steps left after facing forward and then 4 steps right after facing forward make up the complete path. There is no separate component not in the directions. Thus, the answer is No.

To always facing forward, take 6 steps forward, not 6 + 4 = 9. To always face backward, take 4 steps forward, not 4 - 1. In order to take 6 steps forward, it's the right thing to do. So, the answer is yes.

Take 5 steps is the same instruction as 4 steps. The only difference in terms of number of steps is number of steps taken. So, the answer is Yes.

If you are facing out, you are on the right side of things. When facing backward, you are facing the right side of things. When facing forward, you are facing forward and to the left. So, the answer is No.

The steps go in reverse order, every time there is a problem with the same direction. The solution is this: take two steps towards the right. The problem is that the correct direction of the steps is never returned to the starting point, unlike the solution of step forward. So, the answer is No.

Everytime you take a step, always face forward. Take 10 steps forward, take 8 steps backward, take 10 steps forward. Take 1 step left, take 2 steps right. If you want to take 10 steps backward, take 7, 7 steps right. Any time you want to take 7 steps backward, take 8 steps backward. In every step forward, always face forward. If you want to take 7 steps right, take 7, 7 steps right. Thus, the answer is yes.
